Hi, we're Brigit! A holistic financial health company helping every American build a brighter financial future. With a business model that is aligned with our customers, we create transparent, fair, and simple financial products that put money back in the hands of our members, help them spend wisely, avoid unfair fees and build their credit quickly. If autonomy, ownership, and having meaningful input at the company you work for is important to you, come join our growing team!
Brigit is doing innovative and exciting work, but don’t just take our word for it, our work is being recognized by others:
Built In’s 2023 Best Startups to Work For In New York City
Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies of 2022
Forbes Fintech 50 2022
Business Insider’s Most Promising Consumer Startups 2022
The Role
We’re looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to build, test and maintain infrastructure and tools so that software can be developed and released. This person will help us establish mature, robust processes around deployments, metrics, and alerts, both by helping us leverage modern solutions, and by setting the example for the rest of the team to follow.
What You Have
5+ years of experience, with at least two of them in a DevOps or SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) role
Experience with the Kubernetes suite: Kubernetes, Docker, Helm
Experience with CircleCI or similar CI/CD platforms
Experience with supporting Java production services
Experience with GCP or similar cloud providers
(bonus) Experience with some of the other technologies we use: PagerDuty, Datadog, Postgres
What You'll Be Doing
Helping us improve an already robust, modern CI/CD pipeline, with automated rollback, canary deployments, etc
Setting standards in terms of defining metrics, SLIs/SLOs, as well as alert responses, from initial page to post-mortem
Leveraging Kubernetes to its full potential, using modern tooling like Helm
Leading in defining best practices, and imparting them on the team via direct instruction and thorough documentation
Building out tooling/libraries to help improve operational reliability and observability
This is a full-time role which will operate out of Brigit’s New York office, with the option to work remotely for 3 days a week.
The anticipated annual base salary for this position is $140,000 - $180,000. This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits for which an individual may be eligible. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

Flatirons Solutions is looking to hire a DevOps Manager with a talent for building great relationships and delivering technical projects on time to join our Aerospace Solutions team in Boulder!
At Flatirons, our DevOps Manager will lead the transformation to a cloud-centric, release on demand DevOps strategy. In this role you will lead our multi-region DevOps team, interface with internal stakeholders and drive the adoption of the tooling and strategy.
A day in the life of a DevOps Manager:
Lead DevOps and hosting initiatives, and the adoption of those initiatives within Flatirons Solutions.
Manage the global DevOps team setting goals and conducting performance reviews.
Establish and maintain DevOps policies, procedures, and standards in the Business Management System.
Drive continuous improvement through KPIs.
Manage customer-hosted environments to achieve contractual SLAs.
Work with product teams and Solution Manager to evolve the product suite so that it is fully cloud enabled.
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Coordinate legacy deployment activities with internal and external customer stakeholders.
Hire, train, and mentor DevOps engineers and supporting staff.
Champion Agile / TDD best practices.
Participate in on-call rotation and response team for production environments.
What we are looking for:
Experience managing production cloud applications.
Manager and leader of teams.
Problem-solver with the proven ability to apply past lessons-learned to new challenges.
Professional, trustworthy individual with a high level of integrity.
Basic requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business or technology.
Minimum 5 years cloud DevOps experience (hands-on or team lead).
Minimum 3 years employee management experience.
SAFe Agile experience/certifications a plus.
Aerospace industry experience a plus.
Flatirons Offers:
An exciting job in a global atmosphere working with state-of-the-art technology, talented, dedicated and experienced colleagues and world-class, technology-driven customers. Flatirons is the type of organization where you will be able to have a significant impact in a growing marketplace, make yourself heard and contribute to our overall success. We offer you competitive salary and benefits, as well as a high degree of independence and flexibility, including the potential to work from home from time to time.

Description:
Who are we?
Western National Insurance Group is a private mutual insurance company with over 120 years of experience serving customers' property-and-casualty insurance needs in the Midwestern, Northwestern, and Southwestern United States. Known as “The Relationship Company®,” we define success as a measure of the relationships we’ve built over time. In everything that we do, we know that delivering a friendly and helpful interaction makes for a better experience for everyone involved. That’s the power of “nice”. At Western National, nice is something we work to bring to every person and organization with whom we partner and serve.
Does this opportunity interest you?
Western National is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst III to join our team!
The individual in this role will have the opportunity to help with the collaborative implementation, testing, and validation of deployments of software application modifications.
What are the responsibilities and opportunities of this role?
Collaborates with Product Team to design, develop, test, and deploy application modifications of mixed impact and risk on collaboratively defined requirements.
Creates, designs, executes, and manages maintenance of manual and automated tests in all stages of application testing within continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI / CD) pipelines with DevOps teams and ensures automation throughout all phases of the lifecycle.
Influences inclusion of testability during design and development phases.
Identifies, designs, and executes automated test cases.
Solicits and performs test reviews per team / product / organization standards.
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and collaborates with team and team leadership to influence process improvement at Product Team level.
Identifies defect-prone areas in product and platform architecture; designs and provides test coverage.
Actively participates in test defect resolution process and provides defect descriptions, root cause, scope, risks, and impact of a problem.
Facilitates test defect resolution process (e.g., meetings, metrics).
Leads in troubleshooting, resolution, and communication of urgent production issues within Product Team.
Effectively answers complex questions on all the above.
Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
What are the must-have qualifications for a candidate?
Consistently act according to our customer experience standards, including responding quickly, maintaining a positive attitude, building rapport, demonstrating empathy, managing the customer’s expectations, using the proper communication channel for the situation, and taking ownership to ensure the customer’s issue is resolved.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with all Product Team members and with other teams.
Demonstrated basic knowledge and application of relevant Agile testing methodologies at Product Team level.
Demonstrated ability to consistently communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences across all levels of the organization.
What will our ideal candidate have?
Demonstrated intermediate organizational and prioritization skills; ability to accomplish multiple priorities of low-to-average impact and risk within specified timeframe.
Ability to write and teach others how to write manual tests.
Demonstrated intermediate knowledge and application of relevant Agile testing methodologies at Product Team level.
Property-and-casualty insurance industry experience / education.
Jira or similar issue-tracking software is preferred.
Xray or similar testing tool software experience is preferred.
Insurance knowledge is preferred.
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Compensation overview
The targeted hiring range for this role is $84,420 - $103,180 annually. However, the base pay offered may vary depending on the job-related knowledge, skills, credentials, and experience of each candidate as well as other factors such as the scope and location of the role. Candidates looking for compensation outside of the posted range are encouraged to apply and will be considered based on their individual qualifications and/or may be considered for other positions.
Culture and Total Rewards
Western National has long been known as “The Relationship Company®” and caring for our employees is part of that relationship commitment. We value connectiveness, empowerment, and accountability, and we believe that our employees are our biggest asset.
Currently ranked as the 41st largest private company by revenue in Minnesota (Minneapolis-St. Paul Business Journal), Western National has earned accolades year-over-year as an employer of choice and garnered multiple awards for wellness in the workplace. Western National was also named a Star Tribune Top Workplace in 2021, 2022, and 2023. In addition, the Group is consistently recognized as a Ward’s 50 property-and-casualty insurance company for its outstanding financial results.
Western National offers full-time employees a significant Total Rewards Package, including:
Medical insurance plan options and other standard employee benefits, including dental insurance, vision benefits, life insurance, disability insurance, and more!
Health Savings Accounts (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
401(k) Plan (plus company match)
Wellbeing Program, including onsite fitness studio
Paid Time Off – including holiday, vacation, and volunteer
100% company-paid tuition reimbursement for approved job-relevant coursework and access to The Institutes (Risk and insurance education)
Paid parental leave
Bonus opportunities
Western National believes in supporting balance between work and life by providing a flexible work environment, which includes a variety of hybrid and remote work arrangements designed to balance individual, job, department, and company needs.
Western National provides employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Team D3 leverages and develops technologies to bring together the Manufacturing, AECO and Plant, Process & Power industries. Driven by an unrelenting passion for the industries we serve, the Team D3 coalition creates a knowledge convergence that allows us to solve client challenges, implement innovative ideas and transform concepts into real-world solutions.
We provide our team members with the room to grow, a supportive team culture, the leadership to succeed, and great earning potential.

ROLE: Scrum Master - Dev and PLM
POSITION SUMMARY:
Team D3 is looking for a scrum master who can facilitate the agile development process for two or three Dev and PLM scrum teams. The scrum master will report to the Director of Enterprise Services and work closely with the product owners, developers, testers, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality software solutions.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead the planning, execution, and review of sprint cycles for the Dev and PLM scrum teams
Coach the teams on agile principles, values, and practices
Remove impediments and resolve conflicts that hinder the team's progress
Track and communicate the team's performance, progress, and risks using appropriate metrics and tools
Foster a collaborative, transparent, and self-organizing culture within and across the teams
Coordinate with other scrum masters and stakeholders to align the team's goals and dependencies
Promote continuous improvement and innovation within the teams
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field
At least 3 years of experience as a scrum master or agile coach for software development teams
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent certification
Proficient in agile methodologies, tools, and best practices
Excellent communication, facilitation, and leadership skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Experience in DevOps, PLM, or enterprise services is a plus

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:
Minimum two weeks' Flexible PTO annually
D3 Observed Standard Holidays
Company group health insurance, nominal fee for employee coverage
Short-term & Long-term Disability included
Optional Cafeteria Plan, Dental, Vision, Life, Insurances Available
401K Program with D3 matching up to 4% of your base salary
EOE/Veteran/Disabled

Feeling stagnant? Tired of limiting your cloud exposure to your personal AWS account? Want to grow your skills more in the next 3 months than you did in the last year, and have the freedom to do things the right way? We're a growing company and looking for a hard charger who can work closely with our resident continuous integration and automated deployment geniuses to learn how to work DevOps magic. Sound interesting?

If so, we're looking for an inspired techie like you, who can:
Apply knowledge of IaC for large-scale configuration and management
Dig into cloud platforms AWS, Azure, and Google: instances, networking, load balancing, DBaaS, templates, and anything else you think we should be using
Automate continuous integration and continuous deployment CI/CD with tools like TeamCity, Jenkins, Octopus Deploy, and Terraform
Powershell your way out of anything
Know your way around C#, Nuget, and SQL enough to troubleshoot deployments

Bonus points if you're bringing knowledge of or really want to learn the following:
npm
Microsoft System Center Orchestrator or similar automation tool
git
Containers/docker

We do not want you to make the leap without knowing what we need, so here is how we define success for this position:
Soak up knowledge from existing DevOps resources and help grow our DevOps function in the first 90 days
Bring fresh eyes to our processes and techniques and bring new ideas to the table in the first 6 months

In return, we offer:
A mission-driven company with a long-term focus on helping the world by untangling the technical knots that plague state and local governments, particularly in education, healthcare, and similar fields
A home where your voice matters and you can affect real change
Direct connection to the Executive team where you can help drive the future of the company
An employer who cares about you, makes sure you're engaged with exciting work, and offers robust benefits, 401k with employer match, and a great culture.

We need to know - can you make this happen? If so, we definitely need to talk to you.

LCE is supporting a large proposal for the NIWC LANT – PEO C4I Life Cycle Management Support for CANES and ADNS effort based out of Charleston, SC and are actively interviewing key personnel to join our team.

The Software Engineer I will be supporting the CANES and ADNS Modernization & Sustainment efforts using DevSecOps processes to reduce the software delivery timeline and ensure software quality.

Must be a US citizen with a DoD Secret security clearance
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing development, engineering maintenance and sustainment of current hardware and software baselines
Define, design, develop, test, and field software and hardware updates to existing CANES baselines driven by Engineering Change Requests (ECR) and other initiatives like Cybersecurity Threat Updates (CTU)
Provide Training Documentation
Develop engineering solutions to resolve ECRs within timelines specified by the program office, which includes software, guide documentation, internal/external testing plan and installation instructions
Conduct reviews of submitted ECRs, and creating and managing a Software Development Plan (SDP)

Some experience with DevOps/DevSecOps and Agile methodology

Job Title: DevOps Manager
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: CIO
Position location: Limited remote role – KS, MO, or OK

Summary The DevOps Manager will be responsible for creating and later developing a new microservice environment that will allow the company to build scalability, stability, and security by optimizing the current software and infrastructure deployed across all environments. This will involve working closely with the development and operations teams to implement best practices for configuration management, deployment automation, and continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD). In addition, the DevOps Manager will collaborate with other stakeholders to define the DevOps roadmap and participate in sprint planning to ensure that our infrastructure and services align with business objectives.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
Implement, manage, and lead a team of DevOps engineers, providing guidance, mentoring, and fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
Set clear performance expectations, conduct regular performance reviews, and identify opportunities for skill development.
Develop and execute a comprehensive DevOps strategy aligned with business goals, focusing on automation, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and infrastructure as code.
Collaborate with senior management to define key performance indicators (KPIs) for DevOps success.
Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement in the software development lifecycle and operations processes.
Drive the adoption of infrastructure as code (IaC) practices to ensure consistency and repeatability.
Evaluate, implement, and manage DevOps tools that enhance productivity and efficiency, such as configuration management, containerization, orchestration, and monitoring tools.
Collaborate with security teams to ensure that DevOps practices adhere to organizational security policies and compliance requirements.
Define and implement proactive monitoring and alerting systems to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Support incident response efforts, conduct post-incident reviews, and implement improvements based on lessons learned.
Hire, train, supervise and provide technical leadership and guidance to technical staff; ensure compliance with policies and regulations, and that all issues are addressed and resolved.
Monitor utilization trends, manage network performance, and assure maximum uptime; perform ongoing analysis, capacity planning, and technical tuning of the network systems to improve performance.
Ensure the provision of comprehensive, integrated, reliable, high-quality services in areas such as local area networking, network facilities and infrastructure, Internet access, high-performance networking, network security, remote access to IT services, and telecommunications.
Supervisory Responsibilities
Directly supervise team of DevOps. Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) in a DevOps or related role, with at least 3+ years in a managerial capacity.
Strong understanding of software development methodologies, CI/CD practices, and agile principles.
Proficiency in Azure cloud technologies and hands-on experience with infrastructure as code tools as Terraform and Ansible.
Demonstrated experience with containerization and orchestration platforms with Docker and Kubernetes.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Prior experience with implementing and managing DevOps toolchains and monitoring solutions.
Deep knowledge of security best practices and the ability to integrate them into the DevOps process.
Education and/or Experience
Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or four to five years related experience and training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Work Environment
This is a limited remote position. In order to be considered for this position, you MUST live in one of the following States, MO, KS, or OK. There is no Company sponsored relocation for this role.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Is this you? An AWS Cloud Engineer with experience working in a cloud service provider environment that strives for customer excellence, revels in being a part of constant innovation, and enjoys being an important member of the team? Then, this role is for you!

Position Information
Primary Purpose of Organizational Unit
ITS Research Computing (RC) aims to provide a world-class computing infrastructure as well as other technology tools and capabilities to support the research needs of University faculty and staff. Its goal is to provide a state-of-the-art environment to support the highest level of multidisciplinary research and help UNC-Chapel Hill become the premier research university in the United States.

Position Summary
This position is a 100% remote work arrangement, consistent with System Office policy. UNC Chapel Hill employees are generally required to reside in North Carolina, within a reasonable commuting distance of their assigned duty station.

The HPC DevOps Engineer will have a broad role within Research Computing at UNC Chapel Hill, designing, deploying, and maintaining services and solutions in support of leading-edge academic research, primarily related to High Performance Computing (HPC) as well as High Throughput Computing (HTC).

Responsibilities of the HPC DevOps Engineer include leading and contributing to a variety of areas within Research Computing related to the design, build, and operation of HPC services along with ancillary systems including high-speed storage and networking, containers, databases, monitoring, orchestration services, etc.

The ideal candidate for this position should possess a comprehensive understanding of Linux systems administration in HPC environments, broad technical capabilities, and enjoy applying these skills in academic research to further the mission of the University.

The successful candidate should also possess excellent leadership and communication skills to effectively lead complex projects. They should have the ability to engage directly with faculty and researchers, as well as leverage research computing communities of practice beyond Carolina.

ITS Research Computing aims to provide world-class computing and data infrastructure as well as other services and capabilities in support of research needs for faculty, staff, students, and collaborators. Our goal is to provide state-of-the-art environments and services supporting the highest level of multidisciplinary research.

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Master’s and 1-2 years’ experience; or Bachelors and 2-4 years’ experience; or will accept a combination of related education and experience in substitution.

Required Qualifications, Competencies, and Experience
Significant demonstrated experience and working knowledge of Linux systems administration in an HPC/HTC context. Experience Managing HPC Clusters. Able to build, manage, and lead Research IT service lines. Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate and present technical concepts to a broad audience. Ability to be autonomous and self-directed, ability to work well in a team environment. Excellent project and task management skills.

Preferred Qualifications, Competencies, and Experience
Experience with InfiniBand, running MPI codes, infrastructure as code. Experience integrating systems with or designing solutions for HPC workloads. Experience with Environment Modules and Slurm. Experience with containers. Experience managing storage, servers, and hardware. Ability to deploy and manage light-weight RDBMS in support of activities; Ability to manage hardware using out of band management interfaces. Knowledge in troubleshooting both hardware and software. Experience with hardware diagnostics and coordination of repair via vendor maintenance contracts; able to replace hardware onsite if needed.

Special Physical/Mental Requirements

Campus Security Authority Responsibilities
Not Applicable.

Job Title: Full Stack Engineer with FERN Stack and React Native Experience
Company: Gesture
Location: New York, NY - NON-REMOTE (IN OFFICE ONLY)
Type: Full Time
Compensation: $90,000 - $130,000
About Us:
Get ready to groove with Gesture, the ultimate e-commerce and delivery-tech sensation! We're not your average company - we're all about innovation, going global, and changing the game when it comes to showing love and thanks. Our mission? To whip up rad products and services that'll totally transform the way folks bond, chat, and vibe using some seriously swanky tangible goodies and presents.
We are looking for a talented Full Stack Engineer with expertise in the FERN stack (Firebase, Express.js, React, Node.js) and React Native to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about both web and mobile development, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are ready to tackle exciting challenges, we want to hear from you!
Responsibilities:
As a Full Stack Engineer with FERN stack and React Native experience at Gesture, you will:
1. Develop and Maintain Web and Mobile Applications:
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable web applications using the FERN stack.
Build and enhance mobile applications using React Native for iOS and Android platforms.
Ensure seamless integration and user experience across both web and mobile platforms.
2. Backend Development:
Create and optimize backend systems using Node.js and Express.js.
Build and maintain RESTful APIs for web and mobile applications.
Implement user authentication and authorization features for enhanced security.
3. Frontend Development:
Develop responsive and user-friendly interfaces using React.js.
Utilize Redux for state management in web applications.
Implement pixel-perfect UI/UX design for mobile applications.
4. Database Management:
Work with databases such as MongoDB, Firebase Realtime Database / Firestore, MySQL, or PostgreSQL.
Design and optimize database schemas and queries for efficiency.
5. Mobile App Deployment:
Package and deploy React Native applications to both iOS and Android app stores.
Familiarity with app signing, release management, and version control.
6. Testing and Debugging:
Implement and maintain test-driven development (TDD) practices to ensure code quality.
Identify and resolve bugs and issues in a timely manner for both web and mobile platforms.
7. DevOps and Deployment:
Collaborate with DevOps teams to set up CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.
Familiarity with deployment platforms like Firebase Hosting, Heroku, and Docker is a plus.
8. Documentation:
Maintain clear and organized code documentation for future reference.
Document APIs and system architecture for internal and external stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer with expertise in the FERN stack and React Native.
Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3.
Experience using Python.
Strong knowledge of React.js, React Native, and mobile development best practices.
Experience with Git/GitHub for version control.
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum development environment.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Knowledge of web and mobile security best practices is a plus.
Benefits:
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Health, dental, and vision insurance.
Professional development opportunities.
Friendly and collaborative work environment.
Company-sponsored events and outings.
How to Apply:
If you're a Full Stack Engineer with FERN stack and React Native expertise and are excited about developing cutting-edge web and mobile applications, please submit your resume, a cover letter, and a link to your portfolio or GitHub profile with your application.
Gesture is an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace.

PRI Talent is hiring a Scrum Master on behalf of our client. This role is a full-time, 1099 contract staff augmentation position working with a company that is a leader in reducing electronic waste and finding value in gently used electronics. Our client has seen staggering growth and extraordinary impact on protecting the planet while providing a work culture unlike any other.
The Scrum Master is responsible for coordinating large-scale implementations of enterprise-wide IT initiatives, driving rapid realization of our Client's corporate strategic goals through initiative delivery and execution to meet the needs and expectations of Minimum Viable Product (MVP) customers and business partners. Work with Product Owners and scrum masters across teams to apply, implement, and enforce Scrum principles and practices, facilitating continuous improvement and identifying and removing impediments to delivery. This obvious role will continuously facilitate a team dynamic that maximizes performance by improving agile practices.
Key Responsibilities
Helps teams across a value stream embrace Agile Core Values, adopt and apply Agile Principles, and implement Agile practices.
Work with the Product Owner to align teams with the product vision, sprint goals, and other necessary information.
Guide Junior Scrum Masters for a particular product area, remove impediments for them and manage escalation accordingly.
Create an environment of team collaboration that allows for open dialogue and productive solutions for resolving conflicts.
Champion continuous improvement activities to reduce waste and increase productivity; coach organization to conduct endless improvement events.
Coach product owners in creating and maintaining the product backlog, refinement, and prioritization.
Support Product Management in creating lightweight, living planning documents, like an Agile Product Roadmap.
Facilitates events – Facilitates team events, including (where applicable) the Daily Stand-up, Iteration Planning, Iteration Review, and Iteration Retrospective - ensures they are productive and time-boxed.
Assists the team in preparation for ART activities, including PI Planning, System Demos, and Inspection and Adaption.
Support Continuous Delivery in implementing various agile techniques such as TDD, BDD, Automated Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and DevOps.
Calculate ongoing team capacity and velocity. Supports estimating story points/work effort and complexity required based on the historical team velocity - Guide the team in establishing normalized estimates and help the team understand how to estimate Features and Capabilities.
Work with stakeholders to accurately report progress, risks, successes, and failures.

Software Engineer/Developer, REACT

Who are we & what do we do?

Edible® is a leader in the gifting category with delicious, hand-crafted offerings which we’ve expanded to a range of gifts and treats for every moment including our new treat business, Incredible Edibles®. From our signature Edible Arrangements® Fruit Bouquets, Dipped Fruit® boxes, fresh fruit smoothies and more, Edible’s exceptionally crafted gifts and treats continue to fill the world with goodness.

Through Edible’s 1,000 independently owned franchise locations, the mission of the brand - no matter how big it gets - is to WOW customers everyday

Through all our incredible years, we have remained committed to our 5Ps:
Our promise––To WOW every customer.
Our products–Natural, novel and delicious.
Our places–Stores, vans and edible.com.
Our People–Both our corporate and in-store employees.
Our purpose–To celebrate what is good in life.

The impact you will make:
As a Software Engineer at Edible, you will work closely with business leaders and the engineering team to create a new generation for our e-commerce platform. We are in the beginning stages of building a talented group of engineers for this team. You will work closely with our product, design, and customer-facing teams to ship great products and features.
You will have a unique opportunity to build true end-to-end products as our engineers build, deploy, and maintain their code, while influencing both the company culture and the product experience.

What that looks like day to day:
You will make contributions to all parts of our tech stack, which is comprised of React and NodeJS/NestJS.
You will develop scalable engineering solutions for cross-team concerns like UI state management, data fetching, build tooling, performance, CI/CD and other architectural challenges.
You will advocate for best practices in all phases of the software life cycle, pushing for continuous improvement and innovation.
You will actively participate in peer code reviews, providing feedback to your fellow engineers to make them better and to improve the quality of the software we ship.
You will maintain and support the platform product by triaging issues and fixing bugs.
You will provide technical support to product teams, advising best practices and highlighting risks.
You will contribute unit and functional tests to certify your work is accurate.
You will be a collaborative member of our sprint process – we do short sprint plans once every two weeks and 20-minute daily standups.
You will approach all engineering work with a security lens and actively look for security vulnerabilities and with a performance lens and actively look for performance bottlenecks.
You will not burn out – we are building a great product while creating a fun and friendly culture.

We are looking for two REACT engineers. One is a Jr level opening with 1-3 years exp required and a Sr role with 5-7 years exp required.
Location: Hybrid (Sandy Springs/Atlanta)

To be successful, you will need:
Experience as a professional REACT software engineer (Web Development Preferred).
Experience with front-end JavaScript frameworks (React) and component-driven design.
Experience building RESTful web services.
Experience working in an agile team following scrum ceremonies (daily standups, planning, demo’s, etc.).
Experience writing technical documentation in a software development environment.
Experience working with Continuous Integration/Deployment tools.
Experience with source control, build tools and GIT (GitHub, Bitbucket or other).
Strong verbal and written communication skills demonstrating technical leadership.
Bachelor’s degree in CS, Engineering, Math or equivalent work experience.

What will set you apart:
Experience with TypeScript.
Experience with NodeJS.
Experience with SQL.
Experience with Redux for managing state in React.
Experience with the NestJS framework.
Experience with Microsoft Azure Portal and/or Microsoft Azure DevOps.
Experience building accessible websites.
Experience building e-commerce websites.

What We Offer:
Onsite work environment with work from home flexibility, fostering collaboration and relationship building with peers, cross-functional partners and leadership
The stability and resources of an industry-leading company successfully operating for 25 years, with the agility and innovation of a startup, allowing you to make a significant impact and shape our future.
Growth & Development – Each team member has visible and immediate impact on the business, offering abundant opportunities for personal and professional growth as we scale in size and sophistication
Healthcare plans that include health/dental/vision insurance, 401K Plan, company paid life insurance and short-term disability, flexible spending account options and more
Paid time off, including sick days & holidays to support work life balance

About the role:

The Global BA Practice Lead is responsible for leading and building the chapter of a Global business analysis community of practice; continuously improving practice frameworks, processes, and toolsets; aligning and integrating with other Global IT practices and Teams and working closely with all practice members to ensure a consistently high level of business analysis across the global organisation.

Leading with a collaborative and partnership approach, this role contributes at both a hands-on and strategic level to ensure that the business outcomes are realised, and the global IT strategy is implemented.
Our global IT team is experiencing an exciting evolution as we look to better serve our customers today and in the future through expanded digital options and upgraded systems across the organisation. While we are a big company, our roots as a private, family-owned organization, means we can be agile and nimble.
Define and represent the Business Analysis Practice (EMEA) by doing the following:
Establish and communicate expected BA practices, aligning the delivery of business analysis at City with current market best practice.
Govern the adoption of best practice across BA engagements; actively supporting line managers where exceptions are identified, (using a combination of coaching & influencing skills).
Lead the capability within the organisation, seeking out opportunities to recognise & celebrate examples of excellent practice.
Own templates & content pertaining to BA activities, taking accountability for their accuracy, relevance & quality, to ensure the content repository remains up to date.
Act as a first point of contact for queries relating to the expectation of business analysis, providing consistent messaging across regionally distributed teams.
Promote and educate IT and business colleagues on the value and benefits that the Business Analysis field brings to City.
Lead & develop the BA capability by:
Assess BA skill and competency within the community and devise a training plan to address recognised gaps, considering both internal & external upskilling options.
Own the definition of BA roles, setting clear expectations around relative competency & skill within each role. Work closely with line managers in support of a transparent appraisal process, consulting on professional development opportunities.
Inform the allocation of resources, providing a professional assessment of candidate suitability based on competency, experience & development plan.
Support line managers in the recruitment of BAs, offering a professional evaluation of candidates that balances recognised skills gaps within the wider practice.
Induct new people into the BA Practice and ways of working.
Establish a maturity model for the BA capability, communicating the future value of continued development. Use this tool to build advocacy for continued development, and to set shared goals for the BA community to progress.
Agree performance measures for the BA Practice, monitoring regularly using feedback loops to ensure continuous improvement and objective assessment of progress.
Drive collaboration & continuous improvement:
Lead an empowered & ambitious Practice of skilled BAs, using a coaching style that advocates personal agency in their professional development.
Encourage members to own the improvement of their BA practice, advocating an experimental and growth mindset.
Work closely with IT leadership and other Practice Leads to ensure the BA Practice is integrated with the Global ways of working and positively supports the benefits of a global operating model.
Build a supportive BA community, encouraging cross team collaboration, peer reviews and facilitation opportunities to leverage the diversity of experiences.
Essential Experience & Requirements:
Extensive experience as a practitioner in the relevant practice, including strong analysis and problem-solving skills, process improvement & stakeholder management.
Proven ability to effectively coach, collaborate with and advise individuals and teams.
Proven leadership skills, influencing decision making across teams with no management authority. A passionate professional, with ability to motivate and inspire teams with a collaborative mindset.
Experience designing and running training sessions on practice-relevant topics.
Practical experience in change management.
Informed on industry trends, findings and reports related their area of practice, using professional network to keep knowledge current.
Practical knowledge of end-to-end project delivery and solution delivery lifecycles and methodologies, including understanding of Business Analysis, Project Management, Agile/Scrum, Software Development, Architecture, Infrastructure, Operations and DevOps practices.
Ability to travel as this role will require travel to UK offices (Durham) and US offices (Dallas) with some other international travel required from time to time. (approximately 5-10% international annually.
Desirable Experience:
Experience of working globally with an awareness and appreciation of the cultural differences across the UK & USA.

We are searching for a skilled Software Developer with a strong background in DevOps and Cloud Engineering to be a part of the Software Engineering team.

At Brad's Deals we're a dedicated group constantly learning and adapting in the dynamic world of cloud infrastructure, DevOps, and platform engineering. Join a pioneering team that actively maintains a diverse set of AWS services and cloud software. Leveraging a combination of SaaS, FaaS, and bespoke services, we architect language-agnostic solutions for content publishing and delivery systems, web and mobile applications, and data and personalization processes. Innovation is our mantra, and we are always keen to explore emerging technologies, refine our existing toolset, and enhance our operational methodologies. Your insights will be pivotal in shaping the patterns and practices we follow and the technologies we choose to solve problems.
Collaboration is at our core. As a DevOps/Cloud Engineer, you'll work with Front End and Back End Developers, Mobile Engineers, Data Engineers, QA, and IT to build and support highly performant, secure, and robust systems. Our ongoing projects include rolling out a new web front-end and publishing stack, content catalog, search functionalities, personalization APIs and orchestrating everything with Terraform and GitHub Actions. While we're proud of our knowledge, we're always open to fresh insights and improvements. Joining us means being part of a team that values collaboration, learning, and shared growth.
What You'll Do
Design, manage, and optimize website, data, and cloud security infrastructure in AWS, Fastly, and other cutting-edge cloud platforms using Terraform.
Construct CI/CD pipelines, utilizing Github Actions for efficient test execution and code deployment.
Implement and manage web and data services on ECS.
Govern Web Application Firewall (WAF) and bot detection mechanisms.

Administer the platform, ensuring cost-efficiency and peak performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams ensuring delivery and system reliability.
Utilize APM tools to derive and uplift key performance indicators (KPIs), refining application efficiency.
Monitor system health using cloud logging, activity monitoring, synthetic testing, and other APM solutions.
Ensure data integrity and user privacy by regulating access to sensitive information.
Create and upkeep robust, scalable, secure, and automated processes, infrastructure, and applications.
Drive technology decisions and project outcomes, while thriving in a feedback-centric team environment.
Script and optimize internal tools, enhancing local development environments.
Deep dive into Linux system administration and Docker.
Who You Are (Key Qualifications)
Minimum 3 years of experience in cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred) encompassing compute, storage, and networking.
Rich experience with Terraform and other IAC (Infrastructure As Code) frameworks, including CloudFormation and Ansible.
Solid proficiency in Linux/Bash and other systems/scripting languages (Ruby, Python, Go, Rust).
Foundational understanding of software engineering principles and experience with writing utilities and connective scripts
Experience with CDN infrastructure management and advanced caching solutions (Fastly, Cloudflare, Akamai, etc).
Hands-on experience in database and cache administration (Postgres, Memcached, Redis).
Demonstrated expertise in ensuring high availability of production services, deployment automation, CI/CD strategies, and application monitoring.
Familiarity with modern web frameworks like Nuxt.js and Next.js and test-driven development, particularly integration testing between systems.
Knowledge of 12-factor application principles and practices
Proficient understanding of agile methodologies and development processes.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging capabilities.

Eager to learn and integrate new technologies, with stellar communication skills.
Bonus Qualifications

Experience with Elasticsearch/Opensearch, OAuth, JWT, JWK, or other modern authentication mechanisms.
Acumen in security, cost management, and GHA deployment.
Knowledge of email security protocols, including DMARC, DKIM, SPF.

The ADL is responsible for fostering an environment where the engineering teams can deliver high-quality, valuable software. Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities:
Drives cross-team coordination for initiatives/projects that overlap; responsible for status meetings, refinement, retrospectives, and escalating any issues that have the potential to impact delivery.
Actively works with teams to document any strategic risks and mitigation plans for delivery.
Collaborates with the Engineering Manager and Product Manager in the work breakdown process, helps in communicating impact to other domain(s)/squad(s); Gathers respective representation in case broader analysis is needed.
Is a leader who drives business value through best-in-class team execution
Works to understand squad “blind spots” and weaknesses, and develops plan(s) to address
Knows when to adjust the ceremonies to match the need/style/maturity of the squad.
Proactively identifies and resolves impediments that slow development or prevent the team from meeting established goals.
Continuously seeks to identify bottlenecks in order to optimize the overall flow of work.
Build trust and strong relationships with internal/external stakeholders through clear communication and expectation setting.
Holds the team accountable for their responsibilities in defining project readiness and vision, user story writing, story mapping, prioritization techniques, feedback loops, etc.
Challenges direction changes and communicates/confirms potential impact with stakeholders.
Engages in respective portfolio planning events and learns about the functional delivery for upcoming initiatives
Leads collaborative, dynamic planning process – prioritizing the work that needs to be done against the capacity and capability of the team.
Has responsibility for helping to ensure there is a well-managed (“DEEP”) product backlog with PO/PM, and coaching/training where needed for the PO/PM.
Leverage tools such as Jira to develop and maintain relevant information radiators for tracking, measuring and reporting on metrics such as team maturity, team happiness, the effectiveness of agile processes, team throughput/velocity, portfolio health
Qualifications:
Experience (8+ years) in driving large, complicated projects or programs to successful outcomes.
Has a deep understanding of the strengths of different Agile approaches and when they should be used, such as Scrum and Kanban.
Highly communicative with a diverse and profound set of communication skills.; ability to communicate across different levels (ex: Developers, Partners, and Executives.) of the organization with confidence.
Good skills and knowledge of facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, change management, empowerment, and increasing transparency
Preferred Skills/Experience
Knowledge of other Agile approaches: DevOps Agile, XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.
Awareness and experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, BDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games.
Software product development experience
Has experience as a mentor, agile coach and/or trainer
Knowledge of Javascript and react.js a plus
Experience executing process change management techniques
In addition to the above salary, this role may be eligible for a bonus and equity.

Equity Trust empowers individual investors and financial professionals by removing the barriers to investment freedom. #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We work on large scale distributed systems, processing over 1 trillion events a day with a petabyte of RAM deployed in our Cassandra clusters - and this traffic is growing daily. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to developing and shaping our cybersecurity platform. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. About the Team:
Bionic has recently been acquired by CrowdStrike. Bionic is a high-growth company that raised over $85 million in funding with the world’s most prestigious VCs, and was named the 2021 Cool DevSecOps Vendor by Gartner.

Bionic is the first Application Security Posture Management (ASPM) platform that proactively reduces security, data privacy, and operational risk through continual analysis of the entire application architecture throughout production. Unlike cloud security posture offerings, Bionic provides deep visibility into the application layer to help organizations manage the risk of their services, APIs, dependencies, and data flows in production.

CrowdStrike is hiring a DevOps Engineer to help build and deploy automation and configuration to drive massive scale. We are looking for a highly-technical, hands-on Engineer with experience using configuration management software (Chef & Ansible) to release + manage software as well as orchestrating containerization systems such as Kubernetes. Several years experience with large-scale, business-critical Linux-based environments.
Experience operating within the cloud, preferably Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Kubernetes or similar containerization experience.
Working with CI / CD, Jenkins (pipelines), Git, Bitbucket.
Bash, Python.
Chef / Ansible.
On-call on a rotational basis.
What You’ll Do:
Research and iterate on ideal system and application configurations for optimization and reliability.
Build and maintain CI / CD pipelines for testing and releasing configuration and software.
Automate tasks and develop tools to increase engineering efficiency and visibility.
Manage secure, well-tested, and high-quality infrastructure.
Bonus Points:
Proven ability to work effectively with both local and remote teams.
Rock solid communication skills, verbal and written.
Bachelor’s degree in an applicable field, such as CS, CIS or Engineering.

Company Overview:
Cohere Health is illuminating healthcare for patients, their doctors, and all those who are important in a patient's healthcare experience, both in and out of the doctors office. Founded in August, 2019, we are obsessed with eliminating wasteful friction patients and doctors experience in areas that have nothing to do with health and treatment, particularly for diagnoses that require expensive procedures or medications. To that end, we build software that is expressly designed to ensure the appropriate plan of care is understood and expeditiously approved, so that patients and doctors can focus on health, rather than payment or administrative hassles.
Opportunity Overview:
You will lead a high caliber software engineering team that is central to our value proposition and crucial to the success of our company. Product engineering teams at Cohere work with a high degree of autonomy to solve complex problems across the business partnering closely with product and design.
Last but not least: People who succeed here are empathetic teammates who are candid, kind, caring, and embody our core values and principles. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams make the most impactful work. Cohere is deeply invested in ensuring that we have a supportive, growth-oriented environment that works for everyone.
What you will do:
Build a new team expected to scale out the platform across new providers and payers.
Help hire new talent - help with sourcing and selling to candidates as well as vetting them for the team. Provide innovative solutions for both attracting and retaining top talent.
Ensure the team is following and building upon software engineering best practices including testing, quality, and security.
Manages the software builds, packages, and deploys for consumption due to incidents or problems which have been identified affecting production
Manage the organizations Cloud accounts on AWS
Stay current on advancements in infrastructure and security landscape and influence adoption across enterprise
Serves as a gatekeeper between Engineering teams and Service Delivery teams to provide handoff from Engineering to Production
Develop scripts to automate DevOps functions, source code checking with continuous integration, automated test tool configuration, application topology configuration, automated deployment and proactive environment monitoring & management
Be part of a team of collaborators focusing on internal and external client satisfaction, efficiency and flawless execution in the OLA's and SLA's we have with other internal teams
Gather, challenge, clarify, and document technical requirements coming from technology leadership
Your background & requirements:
2+ years of experience managing software engineering teams in a fast-paced, agile environment
DevOps, Security, Infrastructure (performance monitoring/load testing)
Experience architecting and deploying software to modern cloud infrastructure using AWS and Terraform is required
Fluency in Python is required
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience
Proven track record of delivering high-quality software on time and within budget
Previous experience as a product oriented team lead with expertise in one or more programming languages and frameworks
Deep domain expertise within a specific area of the software development lifecycle such as quality, security, or testing

Prior experience in healthcare or life sciences

About us:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:
Viasat is looking for a software leader to contribute to our vision of improving the streaming video experience for customers. As an engineering manager, you will lead the Personalization team which is driving advances in data science, analysis, and engineering at Viasat. The team works with customers and stakeholders to help drive business value by building applications utilizing data and machine learning platforms predicting what customers may watch. This is an exciting challenge for the team as you will build solutions, starting with research and development, and own deployment of these solutions in production.
The day-to-day:
In this role, you will spend approximately 50% of your time on management and leadership activities, and 50% on day-to-day technical contributions.

The roles and responsibilities of this position include the following:
Build, direct, and grow a high performing scrum team to deliver industry leading software solutions
Own a production machine learning application that makes real-time revenue-affecting inferences for the business.
Design and implement new features and enhancements to our machine learning application while providing ongoing support, monitoring, and maintenance of deployed products
Manage the team backlog and roadmap, including prioritizing work requested from business stakeholders
Ensure work is appropriately scheduled and delivery dates are met
Track and report on team performance and health metrics
Coach and mentor team members on job functions and goals
What you'll need:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, a related field or equivalent years of experience
5+ years of related experience
2+ years of experience managing people, teams, and roadmaps (or other technical leadership experience)
Intermediate proficiency in Python
Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results
Strong system, software, and test background including design, implementation, and deployment
Dedication to code quality, continuous automation, and operational excellence
Familiarity or interest in Machine Learning algorithms and productionized Machine Learning applications

What will help you on the job:
Team player with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced agile work environment

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Location: Central Virginia (Madison, VA); Washington, DC metro area (Alexandria, VA); Seattle, WA
ARiA applies broad interdisciplinary expertise in acoustics, machine learning, modeling & simulation, and signal processing toward innovative science and engineering research and development for a diverse set of government and corporate clients. Partnering with government, industry, and academia, ARiA solves critical challenges.
ARiA is a small business where you can make a big difference. Our employees, including those at entry-level, are working together with the CIO of the Air Force to use AI and machine learning to change the way the government acquires technology and working with top Navy leaders to use video games and simulation to change the way sailors are trained to use sonar.
ARiA: Real Research. Real World.TM
ARiA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Position Description:
ARiA is looking for a highly motivated self-starter and low-ego team player to work as a DevSecOps Engineer.
This position is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing firm and help the team design and direct the growth of our IT infrastructure while developing cutting-edge technologies that address crucial needs.
Ideal candidates should be broadly skilled engineers with interest and expertise in information security, risk management, service reliability, automation, and monitoring. They should have significant technical depth, but also have the breadth of knowledge necessary to support a wide variety of software and systems.
DevSecOps engineers with ARiA require deep understanding of modern architectures (e.g., Docker and containers), but must be cautious against overcomplexity and overengineering and ready to move fast in a research (not production) environment.
Strong candidates for this role at ARiA must value excellence and work with confidence, but without ego . Our engineers and scientists all have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of leadership in their daily work. Members of the ARiA team have strongly-held, defensible ideas and advocate for what they believe is right, but are quick to exercise intellectual humility and acknowledge that they can often be wrong. Successful employees of ARiA have strong opinions that are weakly held, are willing to be proven wrong, and are adept at identifying and evaluating trade-offs.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with developers, engineers, and scientists from multiple teams to design, implement, and maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) workflows for build, test and deploy across a range of on-premise hardware configurations. Develop and manage the CI/CD pipelines of a wide variety of applications utilizing a broad knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and security requirements coupled with deep and specialized knowledge of developing, testing, and maintaining containerized applications. Support the ongoing lifecycle maintenance of the DevOps tool chain, rolling out upgrades as needed.
Assist in or be in charge of configuring, administering, and monitoring local and cloud-based information systems, including high-performance computing systems, servers, and user workstations, in accordance with required security guidelines. ARiA IT systems are almost entirely Linux, with some limited use of Windows (for some desktop systems) and macOS (for some desktop systems and server-side to support interface-design tools).
Working collaboratively with the ISSM, Sysadmin, and software-development team, perform or support activities necessary to ensure the safety of IT assets and to protect systems from intentional or inadvertent access or destruction.
Working with a team across all of the ARiA locations including the corporate FSO, perform activities necessary to ensure the safety of physical information for implementing applicable requirements of the National Industrial Security Program (NISP) and related Federal requirements.
Requirements:
Applicants must be U.S. citizens and must meet eligibility requirements for access to sensitive information. Those selected for employment will be subject to a government security investigation.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or relevant/specialized training and experience
Approximately two or more years of experience in developing and maintaining networks and software development environments and infrastructure
Approximately one or more years of experience with Linux and network management, including Agile development practices
Approximately one or more years of experience managing a DevOps pipeline supporting multiple teams of software developers in different geographic locations
Fluency with Linux (RHEL 7.X/CentOS and Ubuntu) including scripting in Bash, Perl, or Python
A well-rounded working knowledge of networking (e.g., LAN, WAN, Routing, Firewalls, and VPN) and IT system architecture fundamentals
Exceptional ability and desire to acquire new knowledge and skills to solve challenges
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Ability to support multiple projects in a fast-paced professional office environment
Ability to communicate technical solutions to project management and the development team
Superior oral and written communications skills
Desirable Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:
Optimal candidates will have experience with many or all of the following practices and tools
CI/CD tools: GitLab
Containerization: Docker / Docker Swarm / Kubernetes
Configuration Management: Ansible, Nix
Deep Learning / Machine Learning / MLOps
Documentation creation and maintenance
Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) experience
Programming experience in languages including Python, Go, or C/C++
To apply submit cover letter and resume/CV to hr@ariacoustics.com

About Pluto Health, Inc.
Our Why: We believe that every person has a chance to thrive.

About us: Pluto health (http://www.trypluto.com/) strives to coordinate care and increase access to needed resources for people by leveraging quick access to data and insights in minutes, and then bringing together care coordination activities. Our team brings together siloed medical data, evaluates it, and works to address gaps in care for patients. Pluto has access to most major EMRs, labs and health centers (about 90% of the U.S. market), alongside multiple social determinants of health data sets, and insurance information. What is unique about Pluto is that it applies automated processes on behalf of patients so recall is minimized—no need to remember names of doctors, health centers, or recall portal log-ins to get needed information, then, our team evaluates health opportunities and works to address health gaps. We empower to optimize care and access.
Operating ethos: We are one of the few companies linking siloed data across health sectors and bridging care. We are committed to patient privacy, promising to never monetize and share patient data without not only their consent, but also transparency with whom that data is shared. Our job is to connect people to the resources they need, not monetize data.

Are you passionate about driving successful implementations and data integration and to help Cancer Centers adopt a self-service data access and integrated patient matching solution? Then we want you to join our team!

At Inteliquet, we believe every patient is valuable and worthy of our very best efforts.
Our mission is to be a key connector at the intersections of clinical decision support, patient therapy, and therapeutic research and development. Envisioning a world where everyone has timely access to the best and longest-lasting therapies possible, we strive to remove barriers so that clinical trials and research work better for all stakeholders—especially the patient. Through insights, technology, and expertise we help solve one of the most difficult problems in healthcare—harnessing the data needed to quickly and accurately match patients to clinical trials and bring more trials to those patients. We focus on improving the way clinical trials work, so that trial access is available to every patient.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
As a Scrum Master, you will be using ?Scrum of Scrums? framework principles in its technical software delivery. As a Scrum Master, you will be responsible for:
Supporting Scrum Teams towards their goals, and facilitating the Scrum Events (e.g. planning, review, sprint demos)
Understanding key cross-functional concepts that impact the organization, being aware of business priorities and organizational dynamics
Encouraging discipline, like no new work entering sprints and be safe-guarding the agreed / established processes, helping teams and individual members to be self-organizing
Leading retrospectives for both delivered software and operational improvements, identifying new continuous improvement steps
Tracking team velocity, product/sprint backlogs and sprint/release progress in Azure DevOPs-TFS and reporting on these
Supporting the Product Owner and Development Team in maintaining a clear and prioritized backlog
Participating in creating and/or improving the agenda, content, and delivery of portfolio and digital incubation workshops.
Key Skills:
Agile Methodology, Scrum Management, Scrum & Release Metrics Tracking , Risk Management , Point Based Estimation, Release Backlog Grooming & Planning , Feature & User story breakdown , Cloud Based Development Experience
To be successful in this role you will:
Have completed Bachelor studies or combination of relevant education and experience
Be a certified Scrum Master with relevant experience working as a Scrum Master for a Software Team. Having experience in ERP based project is a plus.
Have a thorough understanding of agile software development methodologies, values, and procedures

The Company
Metropolis is an artificial intelligence company for the real world. Metropolis' computer vision platform enables people to transact in the physical world with even greater ease than we experience online. Today, we are reimagining parking. Because it's important, it's everywhere, and impacts everyone – enabling millions of consumers to just "drive in and drive out" – that's it. Tomorrow, we will power "checkout-free" experiences anywhere you go.
The Role
Metropolis is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to design and implement software for our suite of mobility products. As a member of the Platform Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to design and build systems and features from the ground-up that help connect the dots between all parts of the Metropolis ecosystem – hardware, machine learning, web and mobile applications, and more. In this role, you will be expected to leverage your software engineering experience to build durable, sustainable and scalable systems, while ensuring that we build the best solutions for our customers.
You will work closely with members of other Engineering, Product and Operations organizations to define requirements and support the deployment of software into production. Your responsibilities won't be limited to just designing and implementing the code - you will also have a big role to play in defining the direction of our product, mentoring other engineers, and assisting with architecture design.
Responsibilities
Design, implement and maintain the software services that make up the Metropolis mobility platform.
Be a key part of the entire development lifecycle, including ideation and identifying requirements.
Moderate technical discussions, evaluate new techniques and ensure our platform is constantly evolving and improving.
Leverage best practices in automation testing and deployment to enable rapid iteration and launch of new features.
Help build a culture where bugs and mistakes in Production are treated as opportunities to improve the platform.
Be a key part of hiring engineers and setting the culture with Metropolis Engineering.
Ensure that the systems we build are highly available and scalable.
Work directly with our partners and build solutions that seamlessly integrate their products with the Metropolis platform.

Requirements and Qualifications
MS or BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of software engineering experience
Professional exposure to development of large-scale, high-quality systems and software products, preferably in high volume consumer facing applications
Working knowledge of Scala, Java or other languages that run on the JVM and support functional programming concepts
Experience building distributed systems using SOA, microservices, event driven architectures and related technologies and paradigms.
Deep understanding of agile engineering processes that support the entire software development life cycle, including TDD/BDD, CI/CD and related build/test/deploy processes.
Experience with database technologies, especially MySQL/RDS and solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a proven ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences
Hands-on experience with container technologies and infrastructure as code techniques would be a plus.
Previous experience working inside innovative, high-growth environments also a plus
Preferred local to the Seattle or Santa Monica areas.

When you join Metropolis, you'll join a team of world-class product leaders and engineers, building an ecosystem of technologies at the intersection of parking, mobility, and real estate. Our goal is to build an inclusive culture where everyone has a voice and the best idea wins. You will play a key role in building and maintaining this culture as our organization grows. The anticipated base salary for this position is $140,000.00 to 200,000.00 annually. The actual base pay offered is determined by a number of variables, including, as appropriate, the applicant's qualifications for the position, years of relevant experience, distinctive skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location of residence and/or place of employment. Base pay is one component of Metropolis's total compensation package, which may also include access to or eligibility for healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, a lucrative stock option plan, bonus plans and more.

About the Job
Loopback Analytics is hiring a Data Engineer to join our team in managing and optimizing the healthcare clinical data pipeline. The ideal candidate will have a background in data engineering, an understanding of healthcare clinical data, and hands-on experience with Databricks. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines, ensuring the quality, availability, reliability, and security of critical clinical data. The Data Engineer will report to the Senior Director of Engineering.

Job Duties to Include
Collaborate with data scientists, data integration specialists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and design efficient data pipelines.
Develop, maintain, and optimize data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing healthcare clinical data.
Implement data validation, cleansing, and transformation processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, addressing any issues or bottlenecks proactively.
Ensure data security and compliance with industry regulations, including HIPAA.
Work closely with the DevOps team to deploy and manage data pipeline infrastructure in our Azure cloud environment.
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and advancements in healthcare data management.

Requirements
Technical Experience:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field preferred.
A minimum of 4 years’ hands-on experience in data engineering, with an emphasis on healthcare clinical data.
Proficient use of Databricks for building and optimizing data pipelines.
Skilled in programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java for data processing.
Sound familiarity with healthcare data standards (HL7, FHIR, DICOM) and exposure to clinical data systems (EHR, EMR).
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and related services.
Strong SQL skills for data manipulation, querying, and performance optimization.
Basic understanding of data modeling and ETL design principles.
Aptitude for troubleshooting intricate data-related challenges and devising solutions.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present technical concepts effectively.

Preferred Experience:
Relevant certifications in data engineering, cloud platforms such as Databricks, or healthcare data management.
Exposure to big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, or Kafka.
Understanding of machine learning concepts and their application to healthcare data.

Personal Characteristics:
Effective communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Meticulous attention to detail, crucial for maintaining data quality and accuracy in healthcare contexts.
Strong problem-solving capabilities, essential for navigating complex healthcare data scenarios.
Collaborative mindset, adept at working with diverse stakeholders and contributing to cross-functional projects.
Eagerness for continuous learning to stay current in the evolving realms of data engineering and healthcare.
Leadership and mentorship acumen, enabling guidance of junior team members and effective project leadership.
Innovative outlook, open to exploring novel strategies for leveraging data to foster innovation.
Adaptability, embracing change and remaining receptive to new tools and techniques.

Travel expectation less than 5%

This employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status (e.g., H1-B) for this position. All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. For immediate full-time consideration, please forward your resume via email at careers@loopbackanalytics.com
