Nisum is a leading global digital commerce firm headquartered in California, with services spanning digital strategy and transformation, insights and analytics, blockchain, business agility, and custom software development. Founded in 2000 with the customer-centric motto “Building Success Together®,” Nisum has grown to over 1,800 professionals across the United States, Chile,Colombia, India, Pakistan and Canada. A preferred advisor to leading Fortune 500 brands, Nisum enables clients to achieve direct business growth by building the advanced technology they need to reach end customers in today’s world, with immersive and seamless experiences across digital and physical channels.
What You'll Do
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to design, build, and maintain Azure-based MLOps pipelines for automating machine learning model deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.
Configure and manage Azure cloud resources to support machine learning workloads efficiently.
Collaborate with Azure administrators to ensure scalable and reliable infrastructure for MLOps.
Implement Azure-based deployment pipelines for deploying machine learning models into production environments.
Implement test automation script to monitor & validate the deployment process.
Work alongside data engineers to develop and maintain data pipelines on Azure, ensuring proper data governance and integration with MLOps pipelines.
Implement best practices for data versioning, lineage tracking, and other data management.
Implement test automation script to monitor & validate the deployment process.
Ensure that MLOps processes on Azure adhere to security and regulatory standards.
Monitor and troubleshoot application and infrastructure issues and implement solutions in a timely manner.
Collaborate with development and BI teams to ensure code quality and application performance.
Stay updated on the latest Azure MLOps tools and services and integrate improvements into existing processes.
What You Know
Should have a minimum of 8+ years of experience.
Experience in implementing MLOps processes and solutions within the Azure ecosystem.
Proficiency in Azure cloud services, including AzureML, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Databricks, and other relevant Azure services.
Strong knowledge of machine learning frameworks and tools compatible with Azure and scikit-learn.
Familiarity with Azure Resource Manager templates and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Experience with version control systems, particularly Git, and CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.
Should have implemented test automation scripts to validate the deployment process.
Scripting and coding skills, with proficiency in languages such as Python, PySpark, PowerShell, or Azure CLI.
Understanding of security and compliance standards within the Azure ecosystem.
Should have experience in executing Azure MLOps project
Problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.
Should have cross-global location experience and be able to handle a team in an onshore-offshore model
Having ML-related certifications can be a plus, such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate or Databricks ML Engineer
Education
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Benefits
In addition to competitive salaries and benefits packages, Nisum US offers its employees some unique and fun extras:
Professional Development - We offer in-house technical training and professional learning programs aimed at developing skills across a broad spectrum of topics such as technology, leadership, role-based training, and process expertise. We also offer an annual stipend for employees to attend external courses in order to maintain professional certifications
Health & Wellness Benefits - We believe that your health and welfare are important, and we strive to ensure that you have affordable options available to you, including some plans that are subsidized for employees and their families up to 90%. We also have dental and vision plans in the US where Nisum pays 100% of premiums for employees
Volunteerism Pay - We believe in giving back and in the US, our employees are eligible for up to 40 hours of paid time off each year to volunteer towards the causes that they are most passionate about. This is in addition to personal PTO and paid holidays
Additional Benefits - We offer all the other important benefits to keep employees and their families healthy and financially secure, such as 401(k) retirement savings with a company match, pre-tax parking and transit programs, disability insurance, and Basic Life/AD&D, alongside exclusive employee discounts on a wide variety of products and services
Compensation Band
$135-140k per year
Nisum is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

The QA Automated Tester I job position is for an employee with knowledge, skills, and experience in software testing and validation. This job is considered to be an entry-level position for QA Automated Tester. Must have the necessary experience to perform manual and automated tests on web and mobile applications and assist others in the process of testing and validating applications to ensure software quality control. This employee must be able to work in development and testing teams, providing constant feedback to her or his peers.

Duties and Responsibilities
Application Automated Testing
Perform manual and automated testing of web and mobile applications or solutions. Testing processes to perform:
Functional and non-function testing
Usability and accessibility testing
Security testing
Data integrity testing
Compatibility testing
Performance testing
Integration testing
Cross-Platform testing
Regression testing
Produce necessary data for testing purposes.
Define and document test cases and test scenarios.
Execute test cases on multiple scenarios and document the results obtained.
Discuss and explain the results obtained with developers.
Keep track and documentation of bugs and defects found during testing, including its resolutions.
Analyze application requirements and specifications.
Suggest improvements to developers and product owners or managers.
Keep a knowledge base of common defects and bugs for future use.
Validate an application's user interface and user experience, and how easy and friendly an application is to use.
Generate and complete User Acceptance Testing (UAT) documentation.
Generate testing summary reports.
Guide and support the users during pilot testing.
Script and execute automated testing

Teamwork and Communication
Work under Agile methodologies and frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
Provide daily status and feedback on the work and test performed.
Assist in the analysis, design, and planning of test cases and test scenarios
Communicate with users in English or Spanish to discuss testing requirements and specifications and to provide status and explanation of the testing performed.

Research
Assists managers and architects in researching technologies, platforms, services, and software for testing, including new approaches, techniques, and procedures.
Learn and implement solutions based on the research performed.

Support
Provide support to internal or external personnel or users during pilot testing.

Documentation
Assist in the preparation of software documentation.
Report work hours with descriptions of the tasks performed and any issues encountered daily.

Continuous Education
Certified ISTQB® Agile Tester Foundation Level Exam
Take online or face-to-face training courses.
Study and pass certification or assessment exams.
Keep updated with new technologies, version changes, new approaches, and updates.

Knowledge
Programming Languages
The employee must possess essential experience in the following programming, notation, and markup languages.
Intermediate programming knowledge
HTML 5
C#.Net
CSS 3
JavaScript
JSON
T-SQL

Development Platforms, Software, and Frameworks
The employee must possess essential to intermediate knowledge in the following software, platform, and frameworks:
Azure DevOps
Office 365, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, OneDrive
Operating systems: Windows 10, Apple iOS, Android
Internet Browsers: Microsoft Edge, Apple Safari, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Internet Explorer
Visual Studio
SQL Server, Management Studio
Testing Tools
Selenium
QTP
Jmeter
TestLink
Quality Center (ALM)
Postman
Appium

Testing Types or Techniques
Black-box testing
White-box testing
Unit testing
Pilot testing

Experience
The employee must have at least three years of proven working experience testing and validating web and mobile applications, performing similar duties and responsibilities, and using the languages, technologies, and platforms described in this document. Also, the following experience is required to successfully execute the duties assigned to this job title.
Work with multiple enterprise environments, industries, and companies.
Work with multiple development teams.
Troubleshooting code and software.
Technical documentation generation.
Work with tight deadlines and due dates.
Work under constant or minimum supervision.

Education
The employee must hold a bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering or four years of equivalent working experience developing Web applications.

Required Attributes
Flexible and adaptable regarding to learning and understanding new technologies.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products.
Highly logical.
Technically proficient.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a timely manner.
Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Creativity in the case of Web or interface design.

Must be US Resident | Must be a resident in Puerto Rico | Fully Bilingual (Spanish & English)

Job Description

Intel is building the best team in the world for developing cutting-edge software to pair with our industry-leading hardware products and our DevOps teams touch the entire software ecosystem. We invite you to join our innovative and flexible team as a DevOps Manager, leading our exceptional engineers in the US and Costa Rica.
Our team, Intel Flex, is an engineering organization that works with groups across Intel on cutting-edge technologies. Our mission is to help Intel move faster on the most important and impactful projects. Join a winning organization that values life-long learning, collaboration, innovation, delivering impactful results, and challenging the status quo.
In this role responsibilities include, although not limited to:
Lead, mentor, and inspire a growing team of experienced engineers in the US and Costa Rica who are focused on improving developer effectiveness across the company.
Provide technical leadership to identify opportunities, remove roadblocks, and mentor team members.
Manage business relationships with senior leaders to understand their strategy, identify where our team can add value, and influence leaders towards long-term partnerships (i.e. business development and account management).

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a similar degree program
4+ years of related DevOps experience, for example:
Implement, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions
Solid experience with scripting languages like Python, Bash
Proficient with containerization technologies and orchestration tools like Docker, Kubernetes
Administration of modern/distributed source code management systems using tools like GitHub
Implement monitoring, reporting and analytics using tools like Prometheus Grafana, Elasticsearch
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience in a DevOps or Software Engineering leadership role, with the ability to lead and develop high-performing teams
Able to influence senior decision makers and lead business development activities.
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) and automation solutions to streamline deployment and infrastructure management
Experience with software configuration management using tools like SaltStack, Ansible.

Inside this Business Group

Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software.
Other Locations

US, AZ, Phoenix; US, CA, Folsom; US, CA, Santa Clara

DevOps Implementation Consultant

Overview
Are you a seasoned professional who excels in both the realms of DevOps and implementation? Are you eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge technology and seamless execution? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
Edifecs is seeking a highly skilled and adaptable DevOps Implementation Consultant to join our team. In this role, you will serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) at the intersection of implementation and DevOps, orchestrating the successful deployment of our solutions on our SaaS platform, optimizing our automated CI/CD pipeline, and providing invaluable DevOps insights from an implementation perspective. The role involves client coordination and communication as well as technical comprehension of Edifecs’ solutions and the transactions that flow through this position.
What you will do:
Work from established DevOps requirements to support complex software solution and hardware systems' rapid development, security, testing, validation, and fielding.
Create, lead, and implement the processes and tools to deliver an automated, CI/CD pipeline-based DevOps system capable of supporting VMs, containers, compiled software applications, scripts, and source code in a pre-compiled state.
Work across the development, security, operations, and Infrastructure (HW and SW) teams to ensure that the DevOps tools and processes are supporting the holistic system development, integration, and fielding effort.
Coach and review the work of other technical staff throughout the implementation process
Install, upgrade, configure and implement Edifecs' products and solutions.
Oversee and administer time/budget constraints, communicating with the client when anything changes during the implementation period
Coordinate with other Client Services, Product and Development team members to meet development and configuration milestones, being able to develop guidelines, programs, tasks, reports, etc. to meet the client's requirements.
Provide post - implementation assistance during the transition from implementation to maintenance.

What you will bring:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
3+ years of experience managing, working in or developing and deploying Java or Middleware based applications.
Strong experience with Agile and DevOps concepts and methodologies.
Proficiency in Java and related technologies and tools such as Maven.
Proficiency in coding and scripting using PowerShell, Python, Shell.
Demonstrable understanding and working knowledge of build and deploy processes.
Experience designing/implementing highly scalable, complex containerized solutions based on microservice architecture and patterns (12 factor principles) and knowledge of cloud native architecture, design patterns and principles to achieve scalability, elasticity, resiliency
Experience with CI/CD and proficiency in using DevOps pipeline tools and technologies such as Docker, Chef, Jenkins, Ansible, Gitlab, AWS CodeDeploy/CodeCommit and Kubernetes.
Working knowledge of cURL, Postman, OpenSSL.
Proficiency in command-line interfaces in Linux/Unix and Windows.
Preferred / Good to have
Working knowledge of automated provisioning and configuration tools like Terraform, Cloud Formation, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or AWX.
Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies

About Edifecs
Edifecs is a premier technology company in the U.S. Healthcare market with solutions focused on interoperability, workflows, risk adjustment, value-based care payments, and analytics. Edifecs solutions are used by leading healthcare entities including, payers, providers, employers, third party administrators, and government agencies. With innovative technology and solutions, Edifecs helps its customers by optimizing the secure exchange and processing of administrative and clinical data, reducing the cost of complying with regulations, and automating workflows involved in multiple core processes within the healthcare ecosystem.
Edifecs is a frontrunner in providing solutions for B2B data exchange, streamlining key workflows in areas such as enrollment, risk adjustment, and alternative payment models. With the advent of FHIR and new regulatory guidance from HHS, Edifecs has emerged as a leader in easing the effort associated with achieving compliance with new federal rules and in making the healthcare consumer the primary stakeholder. Edifecs solutions are offered in both On-Premise and SaaS models. Modern software delivery was supposed to be the foundation for a thriving digital business but reality has proven otherwise. Slow, inefficient development cycles, costly outages, and fragmented customer experiences are preventing developers from building their best software. The LaunchDarkly platform helps developers innovate on new features faster while protecting them with a safety valve to instantly rewind when things go wrong. Developers can target product experiences to any customer segment and maximize the business impact of every feature. And by gradually rolling out new application components, they escape nightmare "big-bang" technology migrations.
The LaunchDarkly platform was built to guide engineers to the next frontier of DevOps by:
Improving the velocity and stability of software releases, without the fear of end customer outages
Delivering targeted experiences by easily personalizing features to customer cohorts
Maximizing the business impact of every feature through the ability to experiment and optimize
Coordinating the release and optimization of software to provide consistent experiences across mobile platforms and device types
Improving the effectiveness and productivity of engineering teams, by providing insights into engineering cadence and stability
At LaunchDarkly, we believe in the power of teams. We're building a team that is humble, open, collaborative, respectful and kind. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

One of our company values is 'Widen the Circle'. Which means we seek out diversity of perspectives to get better results. We understand everyone has their own unique talents and experiences. We encourage you to apply to this role even if you don’t think you meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above. We can find out together if it's the right match for your skillset.
Do you need a disability accommodation?
Fill out this accommodations request form and someone from our People Operations team will contact you for assistance.

Who we are...
Innovators- Our QualityWorks team is an enthusiastic group of innovators with a penchant for tackling the biggest problems in the software industry and coming up with disruptive solutions that exceed the expectations of our clients.

Collaborators- We are a team of collaborators who embrace our collective talents to create one of the most inspiring work cultures.

The Team...
We live to inspire a better way to solve problems, a better way to do business and a better way to use technology to make an impact. We are looking for individuals who share the same values, and are innovators with a keen interest in creative problem solving. Most of all we are looking for Software Engineers whose values are inspired by being impactful.

Who are we looking for?
Tech Enthusiasts who aren't just about finding and fixing bugs but one who is interested in building a legacy around QUALITY and looking for ways to create the frameworks to enable them.

Want to join a friendly and passionate team with limitless potential?

Here’s some more information on this opportunity:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer (QA) I/ Software Engineer In Test (Consultant 1)
Location: Remote. Yes! You get to work from the comfort of your home. You can also work from our office space if you choose to.
Department: Technology
Reports to: Lead Software Engineer.
Job Type: Full-time
Work Culture: Chill. No really, we are! We aim to ensure that QW is the best place you will ever work and that you are comfortable while creating a space for you to grow through problem solving, developing your autonomy and building collaborative skill sets.

What you’ll do…
A big part of your job is to lead the testing efforts on project teams as well as to develop and execute manual and automated tests to ensure product quality. Here, you will create test strategies, test cases, report defects, test websites, mobile apps, APIs, design and implement tests, debug and define corrective actions as well as review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.) Ultimately, you will monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet QUALITY standards.
Our client needs you to always be on the lookout for ways to improve processes and so you will research, develop solutions and tools for clients and the open source community. You will assist with developing content on technical best practices related to DevOps and agile test innovations.
As growing companies our clients crave new and improved systems and so you will assist in the deployments of all product releases, fix packs, hotfixes and conduct troubleshooting of production related client issues. You will also create automated test frameworks and other coded solutions while designing and participating in all phases of the iterative process.

What you need..
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/ Information Systems/ Software Testing and Agile Concepts & Principles (Level 1 Certification) and/or equivalent 6 month to 1 year relevant work experience.
Working knowledge of:
Agile Methodologies
Software development lifecycle
Quality Assurance or related area
Multiple testing tools. Eg Jira, testrail or other similar tools.
Black box and white box testing
ISTQB, AWS Certifications are a plus
Knowledge of data analysis for purposes of creating test data sets to validate correct product behaviour
Ability to run automated tests using at least 1 framework.
Identifying and reporting issues found. Also verifying that issues are resolved.
Strong commitment to quality and ability to work closely and communicate effectively with developers and product managers.
Experience developing quality standards and key performance indicators for software applications.

Share this! We have multiple openings!

Technology has this incredible power to transcend boundaries, transform industries and improve people's lives. QualityWorks makes it happen. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make innovation a habit of life. You’ll gain opportunities to work with leaders in technology that you never thought possible and be trained on the latest testing tools and methodologies including automation, API, performance, usability, and accessibility. If you are ready to raise the bar and become a leader in Tech, we definitely have a place for you.

Company introduction:
Compass Pathways plc (Nasdaq: CMPS) is a biotechnology company dedicated to accelerating patient access to evidence-based innovation in mental health. The Company is headquartered in London, UK, and has offices in New York City and San Francisco in the US. We focus on developing innovations that can improve the lives of those who are suffering with mental health challenges and who are not helped by current treatments.
We are pioneering the development of a new model of psilocybin treatment, in which our proprietary formulation of synthetic psilocybin (which has received breakthrough therapy designation from the FDA) is administered with psychological support. We are currently in phase 3 study for treatment-resistant depression (TRD), and phase 2 for both post-traumatic stress disorder and anorexia nervosa. Our vision is a world of mental wellbeing - Compass Pathways.
Job overview:
As a Full Stack Engineer, you'll be a key member of the engineering team working across our product ecosystem to support COMPASS' clinical trial and the broader commercial landscape. Our platforms support various stakeholders, including clinical site coordinators, therapists, patients and participants, business partners as well as internal COMPASS teams. You will help COMPASS drive technological advances in the mental health landscape to improve patient and provider experiences.
Location: Remote in the US (access to offices in New York and San Francisco) or United Kingdom (access to our London office).
Reports to: Principal Full Stack Engineer.

Own and work in the technical parts of COMPASS' digital ecosystem and web based apps, both front-end and backend
Ensure the system is scalable, secure and robust
Actively contribute to product iteration and development to ensure products are delivering an excellent experience to users
Write and ship high quality, best-practice grade code, ensure technical documentation is up to date
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
Work across functional teams in the company to translate requirements into technical features,
Work closely with other Engineers, DevOps, Product, Design, Data Science, Analysts and QA to develop software
Candidate Profile:
Experience in full stack software development
Expert knowledge of JavaScript/Typescript
Experience with React, Next.js, Node, GraphQL and their ecosystems
Familiarity with microservices and/or federated architecture
Good understanding of how SQL/NoSQL databases work (ideally Postgres and MongoDB)
Experience with CI/CD and cloud infrastructure (e.g., Github, AWS, Gitlab)

Experience/familiarity with Python or other programming languages is a plus
Language agnosticism, understanding of strengths and weaknesses of various languages, systems and frameworks
Strong analytical, written and verbal communication skills
Ability to operate independently and in cross-functional teams
Aligned to our company mission and values of Compassionate, Bold, Rigorous and Inclusive

Responsibilities
This is a full time remote position within the United States.
The ERP Technology Services unit is seeking a skilled and highly motivated senior-level professional to provide database administration support for Mayo Clinic's implementation of Oracle Fusion as the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
This position requires a high level of analytical skill, the ability to organize and manage a varied workload of projects, self-motivation, sound judgement and decision-making ability, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively across various teams and sites.
Required technical skills include extensive experience with database administration, querying relational databases, and knowledge of data modeling and warehousing concepts.
Additional required skills and responsibilities:
Design and develop advanced queries and procedures within relational databases.
Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards.
Maintain an expert knowledge of current and emerging technologies related to Oracle Fusion.
Administration of Oracle Autonomous databases.
Create, maintain, and troubleshoot custom Oracle Business Intelligence Cloud Connector (BICC) extract processes.
Leverage public view objects (PVOs) within Oracle Business Intelligence Applications (OBIA).
Support pipelines necessary for populating Mayo Clinic’s Administrative Data Warehouse (ADW) environment.
Load bulk datasets into Oracle Fusion by using tools such as REST APIs, File-Based Data Import (FBDI), and HCM Data Loader (HDL).
Extract data using Oracle Business Intelligence Publisher (BIP), Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence (OTBI), and custom SOAP APIs.
Transform data into a variety of file formats, including JSON, XML, CSV, and pipe-delimited files.
Analyze existing solutions and queries to proactively identify optimization opportunities.
Work independently on assignments and quickly escalate issues requiring leadership approval.
Size, prioritize, track, and document work through tools such as Azure DevOps (ADO) or Jira.
Follow application lifecycle management (ALM) best practices.
Utilize version-control tools, such as Git, for source code management.
Provide mentorship, technical advice, and training to other Mayo Clinic staff at various skill levels.
Collaborate with and serve as a liaison to the vendor support service groups at Oracle to solve problems, communicate gaps, or possible enhancements to the system.
Handle ad-hoc questions and resolve ServiceNow support tickets.

Overview:
If you’re looking for a high-energy, inclusive atmosphere and a company that understands the importance of work/life balance, Commonwealth is your match! From generous bonus and 401(k) programs to tuition reimbursement and flexible work schedules, Commonwealth is focused on helping its employees thrive in an environment suited to their needs. On top of all that, the Technology department offers a hybrid work schedule, so you’ll be able to work from home for part of the week!

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps cloud engineer with experience in both AWS and Azure to join our dynamic cloud team. In this role, you will be responsible for powering Commonwealth’s mission of migrating applications and workloads to Public Cloud. Your primary task will include designing, implementing, and managing AWS/Azure cloud infrastructure code build pipelines. You will report to the cloud lead and contribute to all cloud-related projects. Your experience in managing cloud and software engineering teams, along with a proven track record of delivering leading-edge technology infrastructure, is essential for success in this role.

Key Responsibilities
Design, implement, and maintain Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline solutions to support Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployments.
Develop automated processes for the infrastructure build pipeline and the infrastructure release/deploy pipeline.
Perform as-needed deployments to development environments and scheduled deployments to internal validation environments and all production environments.
Develop automated processes and procedures for initial environment configuration, including infrastructure automation.
Use, communicate, and enforce coding standards.
Seek and participate in personal development opportunities to maintain a detailed knowledge of industry standards, engineering best practices, and business needs.
Provide technical support, address bug fixes, and implement enhancements to applications in production within defined service-level agreement.
Collaborate with multiple organizational departments in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment.
Adhere to development processes and workflows.
Focus on operational excellence, emphasizing the service management and DevOps approach to achieve agility, scale, and efficiency.
Establish Azure and AWS architectural standards and design automation for cloud infrastructure (Infrastructure as Code), collaborating with technology partners for optimal cloud system implementations.
Ensure the implementation of security policies, compliance requirements, and Azure/AWS best practices across all projects.
Attract, retain, and develop highly effective professionals and support staff.
Partner with security and application teams to ensure secure infrastructure that meets the company's needs.
Core Strengths and Skills
Experience building scalable cloud infrastructure and processes.
Experience in CI/CD and applying the DevOps mindset and principles.
Experience with Kubernetes and Docker.
Experience working in both Windows and Linux environments.
Experience with continuous integration platforms, with a preference for specific tools.
Experience with the following tools and technologies is preferred:
AWS & Azure Cloud
Terraform
Ansible
Azure DevOps
SonarQube
Jenkins
GitHub
Docker
Python
Experience with version-control systems and work-management systems such as Azure DevOps or other tools preferred.
Capable of problem identification and resolutions.
Ability to learn from others and adapt to standards.
Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Knowledge of client/server and internet systems architectures.
Ability to work in a team or with multiple organizational departments in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment.
Experience educating stakeholders on the impact of cloud configuration decisions.
Additional Skills and Knowledge
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or comparable field
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: IT, information security, computer science or related field
3+ years of experience in software development or QA experience
Strong ability to multitask and manage multiple projects.

Job Summary
You will be part of a talented team of software engineers who strive to provide a best-in-class solution for our dental customers. This position is responsible for performing advanced full stack programming tasks for the maintenance and enhancement of our Dentrix Core Practice Management System. Your initial area of focus and will be in Dentrix Infrastructure and Deployment.
What You Will Do
Collaborate with managers and staff engineers to provide technical leadership across teams
Model and mentor in best practices to improve engineering processes
Communicate and assist in development of architectural standards and mentor other developers in their use
Craft code that reflects an expert understanding of object-oriented design, refactoring, clean code, clean architecture and solid engineering principles
Follow the Test Driven Development (TDD) paradigm
Work with Product and UX Designers to create clean, intuitive user interfaces (WPF and WinForms)
Participate in Agile/Scrum meetings and code reviews
Mentor other team members through pair programming
Solve complex problems using knowledge, passion, and curiosity
Partner with our DevOps team to build and support CI/CD pipelines
Technologies We Use
C# and .NET (Framework 4.7)
C and C++ (Bug Fixes)
SQL
WinForms and WPF
GitLab with CI/CD pipelines
Client Server Architecture
Win32 API and WinUI 3 (Bonus)
Qualifications
What You Will Have
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science preferred or equivalent professional work experience
8+ years of experience building backend software utilizing our technology stack
Prior as experience as a team or tech lead is preferred
Expert level experience in unit testing
Understanding of domain driven design
Understanding and defining cross-team interdependent roadmaps
Experience working in an agile environment (Jira a plus)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enjoy sharing ideas with, and learning from other team members
Effectively estimate engineering work within 6-12 month timelines
The posted range for this position is $115,000 - $160,000 which is the expected starting base salary range for an employee who is new to the role to fully proficient in the role. Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including prior experience, current skills, location/labor market, internal equity, etc. This position is eligible for a 12.5% bonus not reflected in the posted range.
